dialogues.text: Where are you? I'm in the middle by the clock.

Just then Kriss Kross's "Jump" starts to blast from the P system. Jamie looks around and watches as... a flashmob breaks out. All the people in the station start jumping u and down in place. Jamie looks around confused. Lorna hears this over the phone and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know, I don't think I'm gonna be able to meet you after all. Something came up.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Yeah. But let's meet tomorrow. I'll be on the balcony. Jamie looks up at the balcony. And there stands...

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: Have a great night, honey. Dylan. * +e OF a +e OF +e OF  FWB - BLUE Draft 7-14-10 134* Lorna hangs up. And in walks in a tall, great-looking bla man. He sidles up to Lorna and gives her a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: LORNA
dialogues.text: And my daughter said you were a lamp post. They start making out as we go back to Grand Central. Jam watches as the flashmob transitions into Semisonic's "Clo Time." He makes his way down the stairs and dances with a sectio of the mob. Jamie tries hard not too laugh, but he's too irresistibly cute. She can't help but smile. They yell over the music and the distance--

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: "Closing Time" by Semisonic. It's Super awesome. And the song I used to sing when I went--

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Not the song. This.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: You wanted your life to be like a movie. Sorry I had to do it in the real Grand Central Station and not a fake one. They watch the entire lobby dance. It's amazing.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: My mom was in on this?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Under MILF in my phone, remember? (then) I'm really sorry, Jamie. Not just because you heard what I said to Annie, but that I said it at all.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I'm having trouble hearing you.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I didn't really think this through. I guess in the movies the guy pours his heart out and then they put in the music later. +e OF  FWB - BLUE Draft 7-14-10

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dylan makes his way to Jamie, avoiding the dancers as he does. He takes Jamie up the stairs where it's a little quieter.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I never felt about a girl the way I felt about you. And I was scared that if we got together something would mess that up. Like what happened with my dad and mom. So I did what I do best: I ran.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: When did you start feeling this way? When we started having sex?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Way before. When we became friends. I can live without ever having sex with you again if I had to, but I can not live without my best friend. Trust me, I wouldn't be easy, but... Jamie, I want my best friend back. Jamie starts to tear up.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything that happens during the day, all I can think is "I can't wait to tell Jamie about this." When I see someone curse all I can picture is you blinking. And when I hear a little kid has been cured of cancer, I pray it wasn't by that douchebag doctor who ran out on you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: That last one was a little weird.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I know. I mean, I'm glad they're cured, curing cancer's awesome, I just wish someone else did it. I miss you.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: It wasn't bullshit by the way. I am damaged. 135  FWB - BLUE Draft 7-14-10 136

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: We both are. That's what makes us so awesome. And our tattoos.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: And I do want someone to solve all my problems.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Here I am. Dylan gets down on one knee.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Get up.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Jamie, will you be my best friend again?

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: (laughs, through tears That was super queer.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I know.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Under one condition.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: You kiss me. He gets up.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: Whoa. That's what got us into this mess in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: No. Starting at sex is what got us into this. I want to start with a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: I can do that. He kisses her. She kisses back. The best, most romantic, most passionate kiss they've ever had. The music ends.  133 FWB - BLUE Draft 7-14-10 137*

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can all go home now! The flashmob immediately dissipates. There's an eerie sil to Grand Central Station. Dylan wraps his arms around Jam as they head to the doors.

dialogues.text: What do we do now?

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Cool. (then) I have a ten date rule you know.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: I've been burned before. (then) Maybe seven. I'll give you time off for good behavior.

dialogues.speaker: DYLAN
dialogues.text: So if we go out four times a week for three weeks, we should be good in... twenty-seven years? That's not right.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: No, it's not. She grabs his hand and they go down the staircase, with D "scoring" their every step. Jamie is smitten and plays al with some stops and starts, Dylan "scoring" the whole way which segues into real score as they head outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They emerge and come across a horse-and-carriage.

dialogues.speaker: JAMIE
dialogues.text: Aw, Dylan. She starts to get in. Dylan holds her back.

dialogues.text: Um, that's not for you. 133 +e eH OF  FWB - BLUE Draft 7-14-10 138

dialogues.text: Thank god. Horses actually scare the shit out of me. A tourist couple get in the carriage and it rides off. Th head across the street to the restaurant.
